name: Bulgogi (Korean BBQ Beef)
author: Kaitlin, The Woks of Life
ingredients: 800g rib eye (or substitute minced beef to save $$$ and use marinade as stir-fry sauce)
method: If using a steak, freeze for 1 hour then slice thinly (5mm).
In a mixer, add 1 onion, ginger, black pepper, garlic, soy sauce, honey, gochujang, mirin, and grated apple/pear. Blend until smooth, this is your marinade (or stir-fry sauce if using mince).

Add sliced steak to a bowl with marinade, mix well using a spoon (contains chili paste!). Thinly slice remaining onion and green pepper if using and scatter over top in bowl. Cover and refridgerate for at least 4 hours. Skip this step if using mince.

Heat 1 tbsp high smoke point oil in a pan over medium-high heat. Fry beef in batches so it is not overcrowded in the pan. Cook for 1-2 minutes on each side. If using mince, then first fry remaining onion, then brown minced beef, then stir through sauce and cook for 2-3 further minutes.
Serve with sliced spring onion and toasted sesame seeds scattered over the top.
